intro: Tweedia obliquifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tweedia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and showy, white or cream-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers bloom in late winter to early spring, adding a delicate touch to gardens. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
